author: m.kalinin
content: The only substantial change that I can see is not every beacon block has a payload. The practical outcome of it is not every beacon block root will be available in the EVM -- it is to be figured out if it breaks anything, but should not to my opinion. Do you have any other broken invariants on your mind?

author: terencechain
content:
I think there are three typical scenarios here:
1. Events triggered from CL but consumed in EL (e.g., withdrawals)
2. Events triggered from CL, not consumed in EL (e.g., whether a validator is slashed or not)
3. Events triggered from EL but consumed in CL (e.g., new electra requests)

I do worry about scenario 2. What happens if a validator is slashed, but EL doesn't learn about it for a while due to the nature of an empty slot? Today, this can't happen because it would be a skipped slot
